abstract: United States Army is training its soldiers in basics, like how to dig latrines and foxholes and make their own meals, in preparation for next military conflict; while this generation of soldiers has more battlefield experience than any in last 50 years, Army is focusing on getting units up to speed on how to be self-sustaining under what are predicted to be increasingly austere battle conditions.

headline.print_headline: It’s Back to Basics (and Foxholes) as the Army Prepares for New Conflicts
headline.main: It’s Rucksacks and Foxholes as Army Goes Old School for New Conflicts

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: With fewer civilian contractors for support, the Army has initiated a training program that goes back to the basics of military self-sufficiency.
lead_paragraph: With fewer civilian contractors for support, the Army has initiated a training program that goes back to the basics of military self-sufficiency.
